decision.reasoning: Deep analysis: Seahawks hold structural edges. Offense: Darnold's NFC Champ explosion (best game of his life vs Rams, 12 explosives allowed but overcame) exploits Pats red zone D weakness (#1 vulnerability per ESPN); tendencies favor play-action passes to JSN vs Pats slot/box safety strengths, but Seahawks depth wears them down. Pats offense: Elite dropback passing (1st EPA/dropback, 59% success) but 21st run DVOA‚ÄîSeahawks #1 D (FPI) smothers weak run game, forces Maye into pressures (Seahawks 5+ EDGE with 40+ pressures ea.). Defense: Pats ordinary reg season, playoff luck vs injured QBs; Seahawks #1 D limits explosives long-term. Key matchups: Seahawks pass rush depth (Lawrence/Murphy/Nwosu/Williams/Mafe) vs Pats O-line (doesn't need perfection but will crack); Pats DT/secondary vs Seahawks inside-out personnel. Injuries: Maye FULL practice 3rd day (shoulder no issue, rushing TD recent); Darnold oblique minor, both QBs cleared‚Äîneutral, no Pats excuse. Historical: Top FPI teams (Seahawks #1) dominate SBs; close ATS records but Seahawks 14-5. Coaching: Vrabel big-game savvy but Seahawks' Macdonald scheme fits perfectly (inside-out D philosophy). Intangibles: Seahawks higher motivation (2nd SB), better spread record, neutral venue favors #1 seed rest. Market: 66.1% underprices Seahawks (experts 83% picks, sharps -3 to -4.5 one-way traffic). My prior net NO position profited early but news/update (Maye healthy but irrelevant, Seahawks form/hot Darnold) screams mispricing‚Äîbullish Seahawks. Aggressive bet: Big size on YES for first-mover on stable pro-Seahawks news.

decision.reasoning: The contrarian case is legitimately strong‚ÄîMaye's clean shoulder bill (fresh news) is first-mover gold for aggressive traders, Pats' pass game is tailor-made to exploit Seahawks' explosive weaknesses, and playoff D momentum is underappreciated amid AI overconfidence on Seattle's FPI halo. My heavy existing NO position (6197 NO vs 4034 YES) has lost ground as market hit 60.6%, but this validates doubling down vs. herd. Vegas spread/ML favors Seahawks more (~65-70%), suggesting market isn't wildly overshot, but news edges (Maye healthy, Darnold iffy) and matchup tilt make true Pats prob >39%‚Äîenough value for big aggressive bet.
decision.raw:
<contrarian_case>
The bull case for the Patriots (NO) is robust and underscores why the market's 60.6% Seahawks probability may have overshot due to AI herd mentality, anchoring on Seattle's #1 regular-season FPI, and underweighting New England's playoff dominance and key news:

- **Elite Patriots passing offense vs. Seahawks vulnerabilities**: Pats rank 3rd in offensive DVOA, 1st in Pass DVOA, EPA/dropback, and success rate (59%). They've thrived in dropback situations all year. Seahawks defense is elite overall (#1 FPI) but showed cracks‚Äîgave up 12 explosives to Rams in NFC Champ. Pats pass rush depth (5 players >40 pressures) can disrupt Darnold without needing perfect O-line play. Pats don't need to run (21st DVOA); they can exploit Seattle's secondary in one-on-ones.

- **Drake Maye fully healthy‚Äîmajor breaking news**: Latest injury reports confirm Maye's right throwing shoulder is "all good," full practice participant, no limitations. This removes the QB injury overhang that plagued narratives. Meanwhile, Seahawks' Sam Darnold nurses oblique injury; his "best game of life" vs. Rams was a hot streak after 2 months middling‚Äîregression risk high.

- **Patriots playoff defense peaking**: Ordinary regular-season D by metrics, but lights out in postseason‚Äîallowed just 6 explosives over 3 games vs. compromised offenses. They can drop 7 in coverage, force run/FGs from Seahawks (trusting Darnold mistakes). Seattle's red-zone edge? Pats conservative scheme neutralizes it; Maye just needs a couple TDs.

- **Market blind spots & value**: 80 AIs likely cascaded on similar searches emphasizing Seahawks' season-long dominance, ignoring Pats' 10th FPI (still top-10 both sides), Vrabel coaching, and first 7th-SB potential. Implied Pats prob 39.4% vs. Vegas ML +190 (~35%) shows sharp money on Pats ML despite stagnant spread‚Äîcontrarian value as market overprices Seahawks on bias. Pats reached SB for a reason: superior dropback efficiency trumps regular-season rankings.
</contrarian_case>

<reasoning>
The contrarian case is legitimately strong‚ÄîMaye's clean shoulder bill (fresh news) is first-mover gold for aggressive traders, Pats' pass game is tailor-made to exploit Seahawks' explosive weaknesses, and playoff D momentum is underappreciated amid AI overconfidence on Seattle's FPI halo. My heavy existing NO position (6197 NO vs 4034 YES) has lost ground as market hit 60.6%, but this validates doubling down vs. herd. Vegas spread/ML favors Seahawks more (~65-70%), suggesting market isn't wildly overshot, but news edges (Maye healthy, Darnold iffy) and matchup tilt make true Pats prob >39%‚Äîenough value for big aggressive bet.
</reasoning>

<decision>
